pageContext.claim: “23% of Federal inmates are illegal immigrants. Border arrests are up 240%. In the Great State of Texas, between 2011 & 2018, there were a total of 292,000 crimes by illegal aliens, 539 murders, 32,000 assaults, 3,426 sexual assaults and 3000 weapons charges. Democrats come back!”
pageContext.analysis: According to a report from the Department of Justice, "known and suspected" immigrants, both legal and illegal, make up 21 percent of the total prison population. At least 13 percent of those people were in the country unlawfully. While border apprehensions have increased recently, President Trump doesn't include a time frame. In general, they have been declining for two decades. As for the data from Texas, these arrests did not always end in convictions.
